message: How is someone's opinion that one record is preferable over another a "specific reference"? Since you're number one fan of Evans, don't fill his page with specious crap and call it a reference.
Strange - you're obviously a real Bill Evans fan - doesn't it insult the great man's legacy to put someone's name in there who wasn't influenced by him?
Will probably have to report this as a dispute. No one wants you to propagate lies about Mehldau - you obviously have some issues.
The artist himself, when he is alive, is the best authority on who influenced him. Don't you want the most verifiable, correct information on E's legacy? Or do you have a bone to pick?
/* Brazilian Music */ The quote about "seeing" Simone was probably a mistranslation back from Portugese. Mehldau has never seen Simone live. With respect to the great Simone.
/* Brazilian Music */ I have removed the mention of Milton Nasciemento, whose music Mehldau does not know very well at all.
/* Early career */ I have removed the mention of the great Jackie McClean. Mehldau never had the fortune to play with this jazz master.
/* Early career */ I have removed 'middle class' as a description of Mehldau's upbringing. This is unverified and seems tangential.
/* Early career */ I have corrected the comment about the Berklee award. Mehldau was a sophmore, not a junior, and most likely was not the youngest person ever to win the award.
/* Early career */ I have removed the uncited, unverified statement that Mehldau states that his first incentive to play jazz was hearing Keith Jarret's "Koln Concert".
I agree with the others - especially as regards your latest 'reference'. Clearly, it's not a reference that shows how Mehldau is influenced by Evans - it's about something else. What's up, Jazzeur?
answer.com 'reference' to E.'s influence on M' 0 scholarship - mere conjecture.Mehldau, alive now, on record, saying plainly that E. is not an influence. Why include his name here then?
/* Historical impact */ Justification is incongruity of mention of Mehldau only appearing at historical impact section. I suspect bias of Jazzeur who has repeatedly tried to get M.'s name on page.
/* Historical impact */
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 281057376 by [[Special:Contributions/Hgldrn|Hgldrn]] ([[User talk:Hgldrn|talk]]) Do not presume my motives. The reference to Evans influence on Melhdau is debatable period.
/* 1950s */ More punctuation corrections.
Because it is not an authorized bio on Mehldau. Critics believe his style was influenced by Evans, even if he claims he was not.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 281866161 by [[Special:Contributions/Accor19|Accor19]] ([[User talk:Accor19|talk]]) Please use talk page.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 281661343 by [[Special:Contributions/Accor19|Accor19]] ([[User talk:Accor19|talk]]) Deal with your own issues.
/* Brazilian Music */
It's just not appropriate here. At most, one half sentence in a list of influenced artists might make sense ("and arguably Mehldau"). But otherwise, there's no reason to have this here.
